title: Public House Name
content:
Can anyone help with this Public House font looks like the 'h' has been replaced at sometime.

Thanks again for all your knowledge.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/blue-anchor-007_4220.JPG)

Font: 

 Coronet
author: Style Embroidery

comments.content: Thanks again but help not needed on this one, now sorted.

Matches [Coronet, at Adobe](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221906/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/coronet/), designed by R.H. Middleton and released by Ludlow in 1937. [Also available from other foundries](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221906/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/coronet/alternate_cuts.html).  
Don

I agree with Don there, what did you use to find the font cause im also receiving Coronet for font. Try using Identifont, Adobe and WhatTheFont.com. they are free and do pretty great when you cant figure something out.

I agree with Don there, what did you use to find the font cause im also receiving Coronet for font. Try using Identifont, Adobe and WhatTheFont.com. they are free and do pretty great when you cant figure something out.

What did I use to find the font?  
1. Memory. This is an old familiar face.  
2. For old scripts, it's quicker to check if my memory about the font name is correct by a quick flip through the script pages of Jaspert's \_Encylopedia of Typefaces\_[1970], than to chug through images online.  
Don
